overview:
Brian Cowan is President and owner of his own 25-person DoD Management Consulting business based in Arlington, VA.

Brian and his team of seasoned consultants provide Strategic, IT, Financial and Program Management support to Department of Defense clients primarily in the Washington, DC area and their field activities. Brian served a twenty year career with the US Navy Supply Corps as a logistics expert. His operational tours included the USS KNOX (FF-1052) homeported in Yokosuka, Japan where he learned to speak Japanese and was his ships’ translator. He also served aboard the aircraft carrier USS CONSTELLATION (CV-64) homeported in San Diego, where he earned his aviation and surface warfare pins and deployed to the Mideast. His other highlights include serving as Military Assistant to Vice President Gore and family in 1992, and awarded the Navy Commendation Medal with Heroism for a lifesaving rescue.

Brian attend the University of Colorado at Boulder on a four-year Navy ROTC scholarship, was Batallion Commander his senior year and graduated with honors as a Business major. He also earned his MBA from the Darden Graduate School of Business at the University of Virginia, where he was award the C. Stewart Leadership Award, and named a Raven Scholar.

Brian serves on the Board of his alma mater, Aquinas Institute High School in Rochester, NY, has run 15 marathons, was a 2002 US Olympic Torchbearer, is certified personal trainer, and an avid skiier.
